rules.natural: Provided that an employee works on a project, then if it is not the case that the employee plays a game, the employee is assigned a desk.
If an employee manages a team, then a manager approves a budget.
Whenever an employee attends a meeting, it follows that the employee works on a project.
Under the condition that an employee completes a report, the employee attends a meeting.
If an employee submits a proposal, then the employee completes a report.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(-(wins(employee, promotion) -> -manages(employee, team)) -> transfers(employee, department)) -> resigns(employee, company)) -> fired(employee, position))
rules.natural: If it is not true that the negation of (the negation of (winning a promotion implies not managing a team) leading to a transfer to a department) implies a resignation from the company, then the employee is fired from a position.

rules.prover9_expression: (-(-(-(wins(employee, promotion) -> -manages(employee, team)) -> transfers(employee, department)) -> resigns(employee, company)) -> -fired(employee, position))
rules.natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of (the negation of (winning a promotion implies not managing a team) leading to a transfer to a department) implies a resignation from the company, it is not true that the employee is fired from a position.
If it is not the case that an employee works on a project, then the employee manages a team.

facts.natural: It is not the case that an employee is assigned a desk.
An employee does not resign from the company.
It is not true that a manager approves a budget.
An employee does not transfer to a department.
